    • Constructor Detail

      • Time

        public Time()
        Creates a Time object representing the current time.

      • Time

        public Time(int h,
            int m,
            int s)
        Creates a Time object representing a user-specified time. Note that the hours component must be specified using the 24-hour clock.
        Parameters:
        h - hours
        m - minutes
        s - seconds

      • Time

        public Time(java.lang.String timeString)
        Creates a Time object representing a user-specified time. The time is supplied as a string containing two integer values representing hours and minutes or three integer values representing hours, minutes and seconds, hours being specified using the 24-hour clock in either case. The values must be separated from each other by a colon.
        Parameters:
        timeString - string containing hours, minutes and seconds

    • Method Detail

      • getHours

        public int getHours()
        Returns:
        Hours component of this time

        Returns:
        Minutes component of this time

        public int getSeconds()
        Returns:
        Seconds component of this time

      • setHours

        public void setHours(int hours)
        Parameters:
        hours - the hours to set

      • setMinutes

        public void setMinutes(int minutes)
        Parameters:
        minutes - the minutes to set

      • setSeconds

        public void setSeconds(int seconds)
        Parameters:
        seconds - the seconds to set

      • getTimeString

        public java.lang.String getTimeString()
        Formats this time as a string containing hours, minutes and seconds. Leading zeroes are added to values if necessary and components are separated from each other by a colon.
        Returns:
        String representation of this time

      • inSeconds

        public int inSeconds()
        Expresses this time as a single integer value - the number of seconds since midnight.
        Returns:
        Number of seconds

      • getTimePlus

        public java.lang.String getTimePlus(int sec)
        Creates a Time object advanced in time relative to this one by a user-specified number of seconds.
        Parameters:
        sec - number of seconds to advance
        Returns:
        String object advanced in time relative to this one
